timeline.bodyText:
Why are we creating 2 streams from lists and then collect into a list?
Why don't we just use ListUtils.union(List, List) ?
timeline.author: radito3

timeline.bodyText:
I think a cleaner way of doing this is collecting like this
Collectors.toMap(mta -> mta.getMetadata().getId(), mta -> mta, this::mergeMtas)
This way, there won't be a need to use optional and the map's values could be directly passed to a list constructor
timeline.author: radito3

timeline.bodyText: Why not use Immutables?
timeline.author: radito3

This is unneeded complexity with the merging of mtas.

timeline.bodyText: Why not give the prefix and label a default non-null value and/or check when they are being set that the value passed is not null and change this to return prefix + label?

timeline.bodyText:
This can be substituted with
applications.stream().collect(groupingBy(app -> parseMetadata(app).getId())
timeline.author: radito3

replies.bodyText: This used to be groupingBy but got changed recently as a discussion with Encho led us to agree that we wanted to avoid having the complexity of 'groupingBy' in the code. What do you think?
replies.author: valentinEmpy

replies.bodyText: I half agree. Using grouping by in complex scenarios, like having to modify the downstream (eg. groupingBy(<some property>, mapping()/collectingAndThen()/toSet()...), is worse than using a regular loop. But this is a standard scenario. My opinion is that all the extra lines and extra operations on the map are more complex than using stream().collect(groupingBy(func()))
replies.author: radito3

replies.bodyText: As we talked with Radi, try using computeIfAbsent and if it is looking better -> leave it that way.
replies.author: enchobelezirev

timeline.bodyText:
can be substituted with
entities.stream().collect(groupingBy(entity -> parseMetadata(entity).getId())
timeline.author: radito3

timeline.bodyText:
This is a bit confusing. The check is if the keys of the env don't have common elements with the metadata fields and then negates it. That's a bit roundabout.
I would prefer the other way around.
Change it to app.getEnv().keySet().stream().anyMatch(ENV_METADATA_FIELDS::contains)
And if you want that slight bit of performance, change the type of the env_metadata_fields to a HashSet
timeline.author: radito3

replies.bodyText: Agreed. I also do not like the complexity of disjoint.
replies.author: valentinEmpy

timeline.bodyText: Shouldn't this be negated?
timeline.author: radito3

replies.bodyText: It should. Will replace this with stream anyMatch to avoid mistakes as this one and to avoid the complexity.
